episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics including the excavation of old Hollywood film sets, the peculiar actions of a landlady with a deceased tenant, a unique UNICEF ambassador with an unusual name, and the inventive origins of the sports bra.

facts.fact: Archaeologists have just dug up in the middle of the desert an enormous sphinx statue. It is believed to be anywhere up to 95 years old.
When British author William Hazlitt died, his landlady was so keen to re-let his room that she hid his body under the bed while she showed new tenants around.
UNICEF has a nutrition ambassador called Pupi.
The first ever sports bra was two jock straps.
